trends: There have been 2 other sightings in Silverton
There were no other sightings in Silverton on or around October 19th 2011
divs: sighting detailsmy fianc��� and i were camping a few miles west of silverton colorado on 10\19\2011. we decided not to make a campfire so we could better enjoy the stars. it was so dark. no light pollution and the half moon was well behind the mountains. we had seen a few shooting stars that night. at approximately 10:30 p.m. i saw something fly directly overhead. i couldn���t make out exactly what the object was but it had a wide, short lived contrail. it was moving much slower than a shooting star or a fireball. i���ve seen large fireballs fall before and this was nothing like that. it was traveling from the n.e. to the s.w. and made no noise. i���ve been a commercial pilot for over 20 years so i know this wasn���t an aircraft. in comparison to the few commercial planes we saw that night, this object was much larger.
Summary: Object flew over head. Much larger and slower than a falling star.
